alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 15 at 4:37AM PDT until March 17 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 736 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Orange, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 736 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 437 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Ana, Irvine, Huntington Beach, southern Corona, Costa Mesa, Mission Viejo, Tustin, San Clemente, Laguna Beach and Dana Point. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
